When used with {-lu':v}, this prefix means "Someone (indefinite subject) does something to you".

{SoH:n}:{ghaH:n}/{'oH:n}/{chaH:n}/{bIH:n} = {Da-:v:pref,nolink}
Когда используется вместе с {-lu':v}, этот префикс означает, что "кто-то (неопределённый субъект) делает что-то для тебя".

table.name: mem
table.column:
While both {DaHjaj:n:nolink} and {jajvam:n} mean "today", they are not quite interchangeable. {DaHjaj:n:nolink} (but not {jajvam:n:nolink}) is used as the time element in a sentence: {DaHjaj romuluSngan vIHoHpu':sen:nolink} "today I killed a Romulan".[2]
As the subject of a sentence, {jajvam:n:nolink} is more typically found, though {DaHjaj:n:nolink} is not impossible. Compare: ▶ {nI' jajvam:sen:nolink} "this day is long" ▶ {nI' DaHjaj:sen:nolink} "today is long"[2]
{DaHjaj:n:nolink} also behaves as a noun in such noun-noun constructions as {DaHjaj gheD:n} "today's prey", a term often heard in Klingon restaurants with a meaning comparable to "catch of the day".[2]
{DaHjaj:n:nolink} is also used with words indicating a time of day to refer to that portion of the current day. For example, {DaHjaj ram:n}, literally "today's night", means "tonight".[2] Other portions of the day, such as {pem:n}, {po:n:1h}, {pov:n}, and so on, are also possible. These can be shortened to {DaHram:n}, {DaHpem:n}, {DaHpo:n}, {DaHpov:n}, and so on.[3]
As a time element, {DaHjaj:n} precedes any adverbials.[1, sec. 6.7]

Zwar bedeuten sowohl {DaHjaj:n:nolink} und {jajvam:n} "heute", aber sie sind nicht ganz austauschbar. {DaHjaj:n:nolink} (aber nicht {jajvam:n:nolink}) wird als Zeitadverbial in einem Satz benutzt: {DaHjaj romuluSngan vIHoHpu':sen:nolink} "Heute habe ich einen Romulaner getötet".[2]
Als Subjekt eines Satzes ist {jajvam:n:nolink} üblicher, wobei {DaHjaj:n:nolink} Nicht unmöglich ist. Vergleiche: ▶ {nI' jajvam:sen:nolink} "Dieser Tag ist lang" ▶ {nI' DaHjaj:sen:nolink} "Heute ist lang"[2]
{DaHjaj:n:nolink} kann auch als Nomen in Nomen-Nomen-Konstruktionen wie {DaHjaj gheD:n} "Beute von heute", ein Begriff, den man oft in klingonischen Restaurants hört, mit einer Bedeutung vergleichbar mit "Tagesfang".[2]
{DaHjaj:n:nolink} wird auch mit Tageszeit-Wörtern benutzt, um über diese Tageszeit des aktuellen Tags zu sprechen. Zum Beispiel, {DaHjaj ram:n}, wörtlich "Nacht/Abend von heute", bedeutet "heute abend/nacht".[2] Andere Tageszeiten, wie {pem:n}, {po:n:1h}, {pov:n}, usw., sind auch möglich. Diese können zu {DaHram:n}, {DaHpem:n}, {DaHpo:n}, {DaHpov:n}, usw. abgekürzt werden.[3]
Als Zeitadverbial steht {DaHjaj:n} vor anderen Adverbialen.[1, sec. 6.7]

Пока {DaHjaj:n:nolink} и {jajvam:n} означают "сегодня", они не совсем взаимозаменяемые. {DaHjaj:n:nolink} (но не {jajvam:n:nolink}) используется, как элемент времени в предложении: {DaHjaj romuluSngan vIHoHpu':sen:nolink} "сегодня я убил ромуланца".[2]
Как субъект предложения, {jajvam:n:nolink} более типичен, хотя {DaHjaj:n:nolink} и не является невозможным к использованию. Сравните: ▶ {nI' jajvam:sen:nolink} "Этот день долгий" ▶ {nI' DaHjaj:sen:nolink} "Сегодняшний день долгий"[2]
{DaHjaj:n:nolink} также ведет себя, как существительное в таких конструкциях "подлежащее-подлежащее", как {DaHjaj gheD:n} "добыча на сегодня", термин, часто слышимый в Клинонских ресторанах, со значением, что сравнимо с "блюдом дня".[2]
{DaHjaj:n:nolink} также используется со словами, обозначающими время дня, чтобы упомянуть, что это часть текущего дня. Например, {DaHjaj ram:n}, дословно "сегодняшняя ночь", значит "сегодня".[2]
Как элемент времени, {DaHjaj:n} предшествует любым прилагательным.[1, секция. 6.7]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a device worn over the ears with both ears covered, with a band across the head, so that only the user can listen to something. The device Uhura wears is a {teS HablI':n}.

Dies bezieht sich auf ein Gerät, das über den Ohren getragen wird, wobei beide Ohren bedeckt sind und ein Band über dem Kopf liegt, sodass nur der Benutzer etwas hören kann. Das Gerät, das Uhura trägt, ist ein {teS HablI':n}.
It was clarified during the Q & A session that this word does not apply to earbuds.

table.name: mem
table.column: This means to make (an image) less blurry.[1]
Dies bedeutet (ein Bild) weniger verschwommen zu machen.[1]

It was confirmed that this is transitive during the Q & A session, and that one can focus one's eyes (i.e., eyes can be the object of this verb, as in {mInDu'wIj vIDang:sen@@mIn:n, -Du':n, -wIj:n, vI-:v, Dang:v}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This word has appeared only in a deleted scene from the 2009 {Star Trek:src} movie. In the released edit of the deleted scene, the actor clearly says {Daq'a':n:nolink}, but there is no official transcript of the line in Klingon. Its meaning comes from context, but it is really just the noun {Daq:n:1} plus the suffix {-'a':n:suff}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Ich weiß nicht wo ich bin.

On {TKD p.172:src}, "I'm lost" is given as {jIHtaHbogh naDev vISovbe'.:sen:nolink} On {PK:src}, "I'm lost" is given in both regular and clipped Klingon versions, the latter of which is {DaqwIj Sovbe'.:sen:nolink}

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a bunch or collection of threads, grass, hair, etc., held or growing together at the base.[1] This is any collection of filament-like things, not restricted to living material. The brush part of a paintbrush is a {Daqba':n:nolink}.[2]

Dies bedeutet ein Büschel oder eine Sammlung von Fäden, Gras, Haare, etc., die an einer Seite zusammengehalten werden oder zusammengewachsen sind.[1] Dies ist jede Gruppe von Faden-ähnlichen Dingen und nicht auf lebendes Material beschränkt. Der Haarteil eines Pinsels ist ein {Daqba':n:nolink}.[2]
Little Miss Muffet sat on ({ba':v}, {-Daq:n}) a tuffet.

table.name: mem
table.column: This normally refers to a water well, but could be for other substances. It refers to a well which is constructed (or dug), rather than naturally occurring. If clarity is needed, one can say {bIQ Daqrab:n@@bIQ:n, Daqrab:n}.

Dies bezieht sich normalerweise auf einen Wasserbrunnen, kann aber auch für andere Substanzen sein. Es bezieht sich auf einen Brunnen, der gebaut oder gegraben ist, nicht natürlich. Wenn Klarstellung nötig ist kann man {bIQ Daqrab:n@@bIQ:n, Daqrab:n} sagen.

{SkyBox SP2:src} is about this weapon, though it's never actually named on it. See the example under {taj:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a person with an "icy" demeanor, especially a tough negotiator. It is not clear whether this is a native Klingon word or a borrowed Trill or Kriosian word or phrase meaning "ice man," but, in any case, this is the Klingon pronunciation.[1]

Dies bezieht sich auf eine Person mit einem "eisigen" Verhalten, im Besonderen ein harter Verhandler. Es ist unklar, ob dies ein ursprünglich klingonisches Wort ist, oder ein aus dem Trill oder Kriosianischen entlehntes Wort oder Phrase mit der Bedeutung "Eismann" ist, aber dies ist in jedem Fall die klingonische Aussprache.[1]

Ordet avser en person med ett "isigt" beteende, särskilt en hård förhandlare. Det är inte klart om det här är ett inhemskt klingonskt ord eller om det är inlånat trillskt eller kriosiskt ord med betydelsen "isman", men oavsett så är det här det klingonska uttalet.[1]
The requested word was "d'akturak", which is how the definition appears in the new words list. The "ice man" part was added for clarification.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is not the same as a {velqa':n}, as a clone is not a replica (copy, model, etc.). It's the same thing as the original, and is genetically identical to it.[1]
Dies ist nicht dasselbe wie ein {velqa':n}, da ein Klon keine Nachbildung (Kopie, Modell, etc.) ist. Ein Klon ist das Gleiche wie das Original und genetisch identisch.[1]

Упоминается только как напиток. Для высушенной смеси, использованной, чтобы заваривать чай, смотрите {Qenvob:n}.
"Dark". Also, Darjeeling is a type of tea.

table.name: mem
table.column: kliva åt sidan, röra sig i sidled

This applies to movement by the whole body or thing to the left or right.
It's not used if a person's feet stay put but the body leans left or right, for which see {ler:v}.
This verb can be applied to aircraft, for which see {Dav:v:2}.[1]

Dies wird benutzt für die Bewegung des ganzen Körpers oder Dings nach links oder rechts.
Es wird nicht benutzt, wenn sich die Füße der Person nicht bewegen und der Körper nur nach links oder rechts gelehnt wird. Für Letzteres, siehe {ler:v}.
Dieses Verb kann für Flugeuge benutzt werden, hierfür siehe {Dav:v:2}.[1]

Används för rörelse av en hel kropp eller sak till vänster eller höger.
Det används inte om en persons fötter står stilla och kroppen lutar åt vänster eller höger, se {ler:v}.
Ordet kan också användas om flygplan, se {Dav:v:2}.[1]

Dieses Wort deckt das selbe semantische Feld ab wie die Verben {HoQ:v} und {Qaq:v} (aber nciht wirklich {mIl:v}).

table.column: دمیدن، دمیدن در (آنچه باد انجام می دهد)

table.name: mem
table.column: Watch the "A Klingon Christmas Carol" trailer where this is used: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/5Nc5t9AZYsM}
The term {DawI' yaH:n:nolink} was used for "stage" in Hamlet. This was long before {much yaH:n:nolink} was revealed.
▶ {qatlh tlhIngan lut luja' tera'ngan DawI'pu'lI'?:sen:nolink} "Why are your earthling actors telling a Klingon story?"[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: The object is always plural, frequently in the form {A B je:sen:nolink}. If the comparison is being made between two (or more) of the same thing, the noun's plural suffix is generally not used.[1]

Das Objekt ist immer im Plural, oft in der Form {A B je:sen:nolink}. Wenn der Vergleich zwischen zwei (oder mehr) der gleichen Dinge gezogen wird, wird das Pluralsuffix des Nomens üblicherweise nicht benutzt.[1]
This is a reference to a line in Shakespeare's Sonnet 18: "Shall I compare thee to a summer's day?"
▶ {targh vIDay.:sen:nolink} "I compare the targs (to each other)."[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the viscous, sweet fluid produced from plant nectar.[1]
Dies ist die viskose, süße Flüssigkeit, die aus Pflanzennektar produziert aird.[1]
Backwards: Rick ({rIq:sen:nolink}) Moranis was the star of "Honey, I Shrunk the Kids" ({yaD:n:3}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This is an ingredient in {ro'qegh'Iwchab:n}, which will turn out badly if the plant is overcooked.[2]
Dies ist eine Zutat in {ro'qegh'Iwchab:n}, die nicht gut wird, wenn die Pflanze zu sehr gekocht wird.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: The Double Triode Limiter (DTL) is a microphone preamplifier.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to vehicular traffic. For a "traffic jam", the term {Hutvagh:n:nolink} is used.[1]
Gemeint ist Straßenverkehr. Für einen "Stau" wird der Ausdruck {Hutvagh:n:nolink} benutzt.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the second highest rank of {QaS:n:1h}.
Dies ist der zweithöchste Dienstgrad der {QaS:n:1h}.
Tämä on miehistön ({QaS:n:1h}) toiseksi korkein sotilasarvo.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a title for a warrior who has attained legendary status in life.
Dies ist der Titel eines Kriegers, der zu Lebzeiten einen legendären Status erreicht hat.
Это титул для воина, кто достиг статуса ленегды при жизни
[1] {DS9 - Blood Oath:src}, [2] {A Good Day to Die:src}, [3] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2014:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: a bird characterized by erratic, unpredictable behavior
Vogel typisch für sein unberechenbares Verhalten
یک پرنده با رفتار نامنظم و غیر قابل پیش بینی مشخص می شود
en slags fågel (kännetecknad av irrande, oförutsägbart beteende)
一種以不穩定、不可預測的行為為特徵的鳥
um pássaro caracterizado por comportamento imprevisível e imprevisível
eräs arvaamattomuudestaan tunnettu lintulaji (jonka käytöstä on vaikea ennakoida)
un oiseau caractérisé par un comportement erratique et imprévisible
This bird is similar to a {Da'vI':n}.
This is a reference to Donald Duck.

table.name: mem
table.column: a bird characterized by erratic, unpredictable behavior
Vogel typisch für sein unberechenbares Verhalten
یک پرنده با رفتار نامنظم و غیر قابل پیش بینی مشخص می شود
en slags fågel (kännetecknad av irrande, oförutsägbart beteende)
一種以不穩定、不可預測的行為為特徵的鳥
um pássaro caracterizado por comportamento imprevisível e imprevisível
eräs arvaamattomuudestaan tunnettu lintulaji (jonka käytöstä on vaikea ennakoida)
un oiseau caractérisé par un comportement erratique et imprévisible
This is a reference to Daffy Duck.

table.name: mem
table.column: "Little Debbie" is a brand of dessert snacks.

table.name: mem
table.column: The object is the thing being surrounded. {-Daq:n:suff} is unnecessary.[2]
Das Objekt ist das Ding, das umgeben ist. {-Daq:n:suff} ist unnötig.[2]
Объектом является вещь, которую окружают. Суффикс {-Daq:n:suff} необязателен.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This can also refer to the suits in a deck of playing cards, for which see {meyrI':n}, {por:n}, {Sor:n}, and {'eSpeD:n}.
Dies kann für die Farben eines Kartenspiels benutzt werden. Dafür siehe auch {meyrI':n}, {por:n}, {Sor:n}, und {'eSpeD:n}.
Это также может относится к "рубашкам" в колоде игральных карт, для которых смотрите {meyrI':n}, {por:n}, {Sor:n}, и {'eSpeD:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a duty station on a ship, not to something worn on the head (which would be {mIv:n:1}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This expression may be based on {DeghwI':n}. In non-slang vocabulary, this idea can be expressed using a phrase such as {nab Hutlh 'ach vang:sen@@nab:n, Hutlh:v, 'ach:conj, vang:v}.[1, p.149]
Dieser Ausdruck könnte auf {DeghwI':n} basieren. Hochsprachlich kann dieses Konzept mit einer Phrase wie {nab Hutlh 'ach vang:sen@@nab:n, Hutlh:v, 'ach:conj, vang:v} ausgedrückt werden.[1, p.149]
This is defined as "act without a plan, improvise" in the word lists in the back of {KGT:src}, but as "take action without a plan, improvise" on {KGT p.149:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: There seems to have been a verb {Degh:v:hyp,nolink} at one time with the meaning of "steer" which has fallen out of use.[2]
Es scheint, dass es einmal das Verb {Degh:v:hyp,nolink} mit der Bedeutung "steuern" gab, das nicht mehr benutzt wird.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: reif sein, überreif sein (Obst und Gemüse)
رسیده بودن، بیش از حد رسیده بودن (میوه، سبزیجات)
是成熟的、是過熟的（水果、蔬菜）
ser maduro, ser muito maduro (frutas, vegetais)
être mûr, être trop mûr (fruit, légume)
For Klingons, this is preferred to {baQ:v:2}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Your face looks like a collapsed star!
Dein Gesicht sieht aus wie ein kollabierter Stern!
صورت تو شبیه یک ستاره فروریخته به نظر می‌رسد!
Ditt ansikte ser ut som en kollapsad stjärna!
Твое лицо выглядит как коллапсировавшая звезда!
你的臉看起來像一個倒塌的明星！
Seu rosto parece uma estrela em colapso!
Ton visage ressemble à une étoile effondrée !

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a {no' Hol:n} expression used by a captain upon taking command of a ship.
Dies ist ein {no' Hol:n} Ausdruck, den ein Kapitän benutzt, wenn er das Kommando eines Schiffs übernimmt.
Det här är ett {no' Hol:n}-uttryck som används av en kapten då han tar kommandot över ett skepp.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the 83rd element of the periodic table.
Dies ist das 83. Element des Periodensystems.
Ceci est le 83e élément du tableau périodique.

table.name: mem
table.column:
Reverse of "angled".
Based on the request, "It forms a gradient to the closest minimum", this seems to be a math term.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the chemical element with the symbol Mo and atomic number 42.
Dies ist das chemische Element mit dem Symbol Mo und der Atomzahl 42.
Reverse of "not lead". The word "molybdenum" derives from the ancient Greek word for "lead", a substance with which it was often confused.

table.name: mem
table.column: be clear, be transparent, be colourless
klar sein, transparent sein, farblos sein
روشن بودن، شفاف بودن، بی‌رنگ بودن
vara klar, vara genomskinlig, vara transparent, vara färglös
是清澈的、是透明的、是無色的
ser claro, ser transparente, ser incolor
être clair, être transparent, être incolore

Something which gradually vanishes (in terms of becoming less and less visible) may be said to {DemchoH:v@@Dem:v, -choH:v}. (Note that gradually does not necessarily mean slowly.) This might describe what people see when they are watching someone beaming away with a transporter beam. Once that person is gone, might use {ngab:v} to describe them. Using {loj:v} would be appropriate if one is focusing on the incremental disappearance of the person.[2]

Etwas, das nach und nach verschwindet (im Sinne von weniger und weniger sichtbar werden), kann als {DemchoH:v@@Dem:v, -choH:v} beschrieben werden. (Merke, dass nach und nach nicht notwendigerweise langsam bedeuten muss.) Dies kann benutzt werden, um zu beschreiben, was man sieht wenn jemand mit dem Transporterstrahl weggebeamt wird. Sobald diese Person verschwunden ist, kann man sie als {ngab:v} beschreiben. {loj:v} kann passend sein, wenn man sich auf das stückchenweise Verschwinden der Person konzentriert.[2]

This word was awarded to {Qov:n:name} as a Friend of Maltz, hence the Canadian spelling in the definition.
In {DSC - The Vulcan Hello:src}, the albino Voq's (see {voq:n:name}) skin colour was described as {Dem:v:nolink}.
The context for the explanation from {QelIS boqHarmey:src} is what would be the right word to use for the gradual disappearance of the Cheshire Cat.
When asked if this was a pun about democratic governments being more transparent, Marc Okrand has said that it was not. ({KLI mailing list 2021.07.28:src})

table.name: mem
table.column: This is also called {DenIbya':n:nolink}, typically by older speakers.[2]
Dies wird auch {DenIbya':n:nolink} genannt, typischerweise von älteren Sprechern.[2]
This was defined as "Denebia" in {TKD:src}, but it was later clarified that this was an error and the English name of this planet is actually "Deneb".[3]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This creature is also called {DenIbya' Qatlh:n:nolink}.
Watch Gowron say this: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/7qXuTn9HpP4}

Dieser Kreatur wird auch {DenIbya' Qatlh:n:nolink} genannt.
Hör dir an, wie Gowron dies sagt: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/7qXuTn9HpP4}

Это существо также названо {DenIbya' Qatlh:n:nolink}.
Смотрите, как Гаурон говорит это: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/7qXuTn9HpP4}

table.name: mem
table.column: A Denebian is also called a {DenIbya'ngan:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: She is a member of the House of D'Ghor ({Daghor tuq:n:name}).
Sie ist Mitglied des Haus D'Ghor ({Daghor tuq:n:name}).
Hon är en del av ätten D'Ghor ({Daghor tuq:n:name}).
[1] {DSC - Battle at the Binary Stars:src}, [2] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2019:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: The suffix for the plural of this word depends on whether it is used to refer to beings capable of using language (see {-pu':n:suff}) or beings incapable of using language (see {-mey:n:suff}).
Das Pluralsuffix dieses Worts hängt davon ab, ob es für Wesen benutzt wird, die sprachfähig sind (siehe {-pu':n:suff}) oder nicht (siehe {-mey:n:suff}).

table.name: mem
table.column: vara tidigare, vara föregående, vara före detta, ex-
This verb is also used idiomatically, so that for example {Deq SuvwI'@@Deq:v, SuvwI':n} is similar to the English expression "That warrior is history".
Dieses Verb wird auch idiomatisch benutzt wird, so dass z.B. {Deq SuvwI'@@Deq:v, SuvwI':n} dem deutschen Ausdruck "Der Krieger ist Vergangenheit/erledigt" ähnelt.
Detta verb används också idiomatiskt, till exempel har {Deq SuvwI'@@Deq:v, SuvwI':n} en betydelse i stil med "Den där krigaren är historia".

table.name: mem
table.column: veer (to the left or right while traveling or moving)
abbiegen (nach links oder rechts auf einer Reiseroute), ausscheren
veer (در سمت چپ یا راست در هنگام مسافرت یا حرکت)
veer (till vänster eller höger när du reser eller flyttar)
поворот (влево или вправо во время путешествия или перемещения)
轉向（行駛或移動時向左或向右）
virar (para a esquerda ou direita enquanto viaja ou se move)
virer (vers la gauche ou la droite en voyageant ou en se déplaçant)

This means to change direction to the left or right while traveling or moving.
This verb can be applied to aircraft, for which see {Der:v:2}.[1]

Dies bedeutet nach links oder rechts die Richtung zu ändern während man fährt, fliegt, geht etc.
Dieses Verb kann für Flugzeuge verwendet werden, hierfür siehe {Der:v:2}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: yaw (aircraft nose points left or right)
انهدام (نقطه بینی هواپیما چپ یا راست)
vara girande, vara svängande (flygmaskin rör nosen till höger eller vänster)
рыскание (нос самолета указывает влево или вправо)
guinar (nariz da aeronave aponta para a esquerda ou direita)
dévier (le nez de l'avion pointe vers la gauche ou la droite)
This is just the verb {Der:v:1} applied to aircraft.
Dies ist einfach das Verb {Der:v:1} auf Flugzeuge angewandt.
The rud"der" controls the yaw on an airplane.

table.name: mem
table.column: surrender (something), relinquish, give away, let go of
تسلیم کردن (چیزی)، رها کردن، بخشش کردن، رها کردن
överlämna (något), avstå, ge bort, släppa taget
luovuttaa jotakin, luopua jostakin, antaa pois
abandonner (quelque chose), abandonner, donner, lâcher prise
This is a different sense of "surrender" or "give up" than {jegh:v}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: "Dead Man's Chest", also known as "Derelict", is a fictional song from the novel Treasure Island.

table.name: mem
table.column: program, agenda, dagordning, schema, kalendarium, tidsplan

table.name: mem
table.column: A writer's arm rests on his or her desk when writing.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is used for both the body part and the handle of a {nevDagh:n}. Note that the suffix {-Du':n} is used even with the latter meaning.
Dieses Wort wird sowohl für das Körperteil als auch den Henkel eines {nevDagh:n} benutzt. Merke, dass das Suffix {-Du':n} auch in der letzteren Bedeutung genutzt wird.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the inner part of the forearm, which extends from the palm to the elbow pit ({DeS tutren:n}).[1]
Dies ist der innere Teil des Unterarms, vom Handteller bis zur Ellbogenbeuge ({DeS tutren:n}).[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the entire upper part of the arm. Unless specificity is called for, {DeS:n:nolink} is generally left out of {DeS nev'ob:n:nolink}.[2]
Dies ist der gesamte obere Teil des Arms. Außer wenn Klarheit nötig ist, wird {DeS:n:nolink} im Allgemeinen weggelassen.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the outer part of the forearm, which extends from the back of the hand to the outer part of the elbow. The other side is the {DeS Do'ghI':n}, while the entire forearm is the {cha'neH:n}. Unless specificity is called for, {DeS:n:nolink} is generally left out of {DeS reStav:n:nolink}.[2]

Dies ist der äußere Teil des Unterarms, vom Handrücken bis zum Ellenbogen. Die andere Seite ist die {DeS Do'ghI':n}, während der ganze Unterarm {cha'neH:n} ist. Außer wenn Klarstellung nötig ist, wird {DeS:n:nolink} im Allgemeinen weggelassen.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: cathetus, shorter side of right-angled triangle
Kathete, eine der Seiten eines rechtwinkligen Dreiecks
cateto, lado menor de um triângulo retângulo
The three sides of a right-triangle ({ra'Duch leD:n}), relative to a non-right angle, are the {DeS Sum:n}, {DeS Hop:n}, and the {qubbID:n:2}.[1]
Die drei Seiten eines rechtwinkligen Dreiecks ({ra'Duch leD:n}) sind {DeS Sum:n}, {DeS Hop:n} (Katheten) und die {qubbID:n:2} (Hypothenuse).[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: opposite side (of an angle in a right triangle)
gegenüberliegende Seite eines Winkels in einem rechtwinkligen Dreieck
ضلع مقابل (زاویه در مثلث قائم الزاویه)
motsatt sida (av en vinkel i en rätvinklig triangel)
（直角三角形中一個角的對邊）
lado oposto (de um ângulo em um triângulo retângulo)
côté opposé (d'un angle dans un triangle rectangle)

table.name: mem
table.column: adjacent side (of an angle in a right triangle)
angrenzende Seite eines Winkels in einem rechtwinkligen Dreieck
ضلع مجاور (زاویه در مثلث قائم الزاویه)
intilliggande sida (av en vinkel i en rätvinklig triangel)
lado adjacente (de um ângulo em um triângulo retângulo)
côté adjacent (d'un angle dans un triangle rectangle)

table.name: mem
table.column: pedal (foot lever such as for piano)
pedal (alavanca de pé, como para piano)
pédale (levier au pied comme pour le piano)
This is a lever (with the fulcrum at one end) controlled by the foot, such as a pedal on a piano or organ. This is typically the object of the verb {ghujmoH:v@@ghuj:v, -moH:v}.[1]
Ein Hebel (mit dem Drehpunkt an einem Ende), der mit dem Fuß bedient wird, wie die Pedale eines Klaviers oder einer Orgel. Dies ist typischerweise das Objekt des Verbs {ghujmoH:v@@ghuj:v, -moH:v}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a pedal with the fulcrum in the middle (rather than at one end) that is typically pressed downward with either the front of the foot or the heel. The verb {ghujmoH:v@@ghuj:v, -moH:v} is used with this.[1]

Dies ist ein Pedal mit dem Drehpunkt in der Mitte (statt an einem der Enden), das normalerweise entweder mit dem Vorderfuß oder der Ferse heruntergredrückt wird. Das Verb {ghujmoH:v@@ghuj:v, -moH:v} wird mit diesem Nomen verwendet.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: closet, cupboard, cabinet, fixed storage device
گنجه، کابینت، کابینت، دستگاه ذخیره سازی ثابت
шкаф, комод, тумба, стационарное устройство хранения
壁櫥、櫥櫃、櫃子、固定存儲設備
armário, cômoda, dispositivo de armazenamento fixo
placard, penderie, armoire, dispositif de rangement fixe
This does not necessarily have to be fixed in place.
Dies muss nicht notwendigerweise an einem Ort festgemacht sein.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is not a Klingon device as Klingons prefer live food, but refers to something found in many Terran homes.
Dies ist kein klingonisches Gerät, da Klingonen lebendes Essen vorziehen, aber es bezieht sich auf etwas, das in vielen terranischen Haushalten steht.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the general term for being electrically charged (as opposed to being positively or negatively charged).[1]
Dies ist der allgemeine Ausdruck für elektrisch geladen (im Gegensatz zu positiv oder negativ geladen sein).[1]
Det här är den mest allmän uttryck för vara elektriskt laddad (i motsats till vara positivt eller negativt laddad).[1]
Ceci est le terme général pour être chargé éléctriquement (par opposition à être positivement ou négativement chargé)-[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is not defined in canon, but its meaning is inferred from its translation and components.
▶ {tlhIngan tIgh - SuvwI' DevmeH paq@@tlhIngan:n, tIgh:n, SuvwI':n, DevmeH paq:n} "The Klingon Way - A Warrior's Guide"

table.name: mem
table.column: If you're looking for someone named "Data", see {qoqyoq:n:hyp}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Knowledge of useful information may be unfortunate.
Das Wissen nützlicher Informationen kann nachteilig sein.
آگاهی از اطلاعات مفید ممکن است مایه تاسف باشد.
Kunskap om användbar information kan vara olycklig.
Знание полезной информации может быть неудачным.
對有用信息的了解可能是不幸的。
O conhecimento de informações úteis pode ser lamentável.
La connaissance d’informations utiles peut s’avérer malheureuse.

table.name: mem
table.column: به هر حال ، از نظر والدین
This is a shortened form of {'ej De' vIchel:adv}. Klingon grammarians argue about whether the resulting {De'chel:adv} should be considered an adverbial in its own right.[1]
Dies ist eine Kurzform von {'ej De' vIchel:adv}. Klingonische Grammatiker diskutieren, ob das resultierende {De'chel:adv} als eigenständiges Adverb gelten sollte.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: 滴水石（地質）、鐘乳石、石筍

There is a single word for both stalactite and stalagmite. If a distinction is needed, one says {pa' beb De'lor:n@@pa' beb:n, De'lor:n} and {rav De'lor:n@@rav:n:1, De'lor:n}. One never says {rav'eq De'lor:n@@rav'eq:n, De'lor:n}.

Es gibt ein einziges Wort für Stalaktit und Stalagmit. Wenn die Unterscheidung notwendig ist, sagt man {pa' beb De'lor:n@@pa' beb:n, De'lor:n} und {rav De'lor:n@@rav:n:1, De'lor:n}. Man sagt niemals {rav'eq De'lor:n@@rav'eq:n, De'lor:n}.
Data ({De':n}) and Lore are alike, and yet opposite.

table.name: mem
table.column: It's explicitly stated that the second part is "chain".[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This term is normally used only for fairly big (or powerful) computers.[2]
Dieser Ausdruck wird normalerweise nur für ziemlich große (oder leistungsstarke) Computer benutzt.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: 膝上型電腦、筆記本電腦

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {qatlh Dat DI tu'lu', tlhIngan?:sen:nolink} "Why is there rubble everywhere, Klingon?"[2]
▶ {qatlh Dat DI tu'lu', tlhIngan?:sen:nolink} "Warum ist hier überall Schutt, Klingone?"[2]
▶ {qatlh Dat DI tu'lu', tlhIngan?:sen:nolink} "Почему здесь повсюду мусор, Клингон?"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a component of a cloaking device. Note that it refers to a physical object and not a force field.
Dies ist eine Komponente der Tarnvorrichtung. Merke, dass es sich auf einen Gegenstand bezieht und nicht auf ein Kraftfeld.
This only appears in English in the manual. The Klingon term was provided at {qep'a' 30 (2023):src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: In slang, "(first) dibs" means the right to something.

table.name: mem
table.column: This suffix turns a cardinal number into an ordinal number. For example, {wa'DIch:n:num} "first" from {wa':n:num} "one", {cha'DIch:n:1,num} "second" from {cha':n:num} "two", and so on. Ordinal numbers follow the noun to which they apply.

Dieses Suffix macht aus einer Kardinalzahl eine Ordinalzahl. Zum Beispiel, {wa'DIch:n:num} "erste/r/s" von {wa':n:num} "eins", {cha'DIch:n:1,num} "zweite/r/s" von {cha':n:num} "zwei", usw. Ordinalzahlen folgen dem Nomen, auf das sie sich beziehen.

Этот суффикс превращает количественное числительное в порядковый номер. Например, {wa'DIch:n:num} "первый" из {wa':n:num} "один", {cha'DIch:n:1,num} "второй" из {cha':n:num} "два", и так далее. Порядковые номера следуют за именем существительным, к которым они применяются.

table.name: mem
table.column: The locution {DIDmoH:v@@DID:v, -moH:v} is used to mean "speak of or refer to (whatever the object of the verb is) in stereotypical terms".[1]
Der Ausdruck {DIDmoH:v@@DID:v, -moH:v} wird für "über (was auch immer das Objekt des Verbs ist) mit klischeehaften Ausdrücken sprechen" benutzt.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: An undertaker is someone who "dig"s. The slang phrase "infra dig" (from Latin "infra dignitatem") means "beneath one's dignity".
▶ {DaH nuq wIDIgh:sen:nolink} "What do we undertake now?"

table.name: mem
table.column: Its leaf ({DIghna' por:n:nolink}) is fried (see {mIQ:v}) by experienced cooks.[1, p.94]
Sein Blatt ({DIghna' por:n:nolink}) wird von erfahrenen Köchen frittiert (siehe {mIQ:v}).[1, p.94]
This is the closest Klingon thing to a Terran poppy.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is deep-fried (see {mIQ:v}) and eaten.[1, p.94]
Dies wird frittiert (siehe {mIQ:v} und gegessen.[1, p.94]
De här friteras (se {mIQ:v}) och äts. [1, p.94]

slå med svärd längsmed motståndares klinga
скользить лезвием меча по лезвию противника

table.name: mem
table.column: use a pigment stick, paint with pigment stick
استفاده از چوب رنگدانه، رنگ با چوب رنگدانه
använda en pigmentpinne, måla med pigmentpinne
используйте пигментную палочку, рисуйте пигментной палочкой
使用顏料棒、塗上顏料棒
use um bastão de pigmento, pinte com um bastão de pigmento
utilisez un bâton de pigment, peignez avec un bâton de pigment

The object of this verb is the thing which is touched by a {rItlh naQ:n}, for example a {nagh beQ:n}. Since {DIj:v:2,nolink} is already associated with {nagh beQ:n:nolink}, it can be left out. However, if painting or drawing on something other than a {nagh beQ:n:nolink}, it should be specified.[2]
To specify the thing to be drawn, one can use the verbs {cha':v} or {nargh:v:0}. The latter means both "appear" and "escape", and similar to how {qon:v} is used for composing music or writing stories, its use suggests that the picture already exists and the {DIjwI':n} is somehow enabling it to escape and appear. Usually {nargh:v:0,nolink} is used with the suffix {-moH:v}, but it's also possible to use it without, though this construction is heard less frequently. The {cha':v:nolink} version is more common in informal settings and the {nargh:v:nolink} (usually {narghmoH:v:nolink}) version is more common in literature or in discussions about art.[2]
This verb can be used for producing a visual image even if no paint or pigment stick is involved, for example with a pencil, or with a device or computer software.[2]

Verbin objekti on pinta, jolle maalitikulla ({rItlh naQ:n}) piirretään, yleensä kivitaulu ({nagh beQ:n}). Koska {DIj:v:2,nolink} assosioituu vahvasti {nagh beQ:n:nolink}:iin, on se oletus jos objektia ei ole. Jos pinta on jokin muu kuin {nagh beQ:n:nolink}, on se selkeyden vuoksi hyvä kertoa.
Piirrettävä asia voidaan määritellä verbillä {cha':v} (näyttää) tai {nargh:v:0} (ilmestyä, paeta, karata). Jälkimmäinen verbi on samanlainen kuin kirjoittamisen ja säveltämisen yhteydessä käytettävä {qon:v}: kuvan ajatellaan olevan jo olemassa ja maalaaja ({DIjwI':n}) mahdollistaa sen pakenemisen ja ilmestymisen. Yleensä {nargh:v:0,nolink}-verbiä käytetään {-moH:v}-päätteen kanssa, vaikka sen käyttäminen ilman päätettä on myös sallittua joskin harvinaisempaa. {cha':v:nolink}-verbin käyttäminen on yleisempää epämuodollisemmissa tilanteissa ja {nargh:v:nolink} (yleensä {narghmoH:v:nolink})-verbi on yleisempi kirjallisuudessa ja taiteessa käytävissä keskusteluissa.
Tätä verbiä käytetään myös muunlaisesta piirtämisestä kuin maalitikulla maalaamisesta. Sitä voi käyttää esimerkiksi kynällä tai tietokoneella piirtämisestä.[2]

▶ {DI'raq Dacha'meH nagh beQ yIDIj:sen:nolink} "Paint the stone panel with [a picture of] a sheep!"[2] ▶ {DI'raq Dacha'meH yIDIj:sen:nolink} "Paint [a picture of] a sheep!"[2] ▶ {DI'raq DanarghmoHmeH nagh beQ yIDIj:sen:nolink} "Paint the stone panel with [a picture of] a sheep!"[2] ▶ {DI'raq DanarghmoHmeH yIDIj:sen:nolink} "Paint [a picture of] a sheep!"[2] ▶ {narghmeH DI'raq (nagh beQ) yIDIj:sen:nolink} "Paint (the stone panel with) [a picture of] a sheep!"[2] ▶ {DI'raq Dacha'meH nav yIDIj:sen:nolink} or {DI'raq DanarghmoHmeH nav yIDIj:sen:nolink} "Draw a sheep on the paper!"[2]

▶ {DI'raq Dacha'meH nagh beQ yIDIj:sen:nolink} "Maalaa lammas kivitaululle!"[2] ▶ {DI'raq Dacha'meH yIDIj:sen:nolink} "Maalaa kuva lampaasta!"[2] ▶ {DI'raq DanarghmoHmeH nagh beQ yIDIj:sen:nolink} "Maalaa lammas kivitaululle!"[2] ▶ {DI'raq DanarghmoHmeH yIDIj:sen:nolink} "Maalaa kuva lampaasta!"[2] ▶ {narghmeH DI'raq (nagh beQ) yIDIj:sen:nolink} "Maalaa lammas (kivitaululle)!"[2] ▶ {DI'raq Dacha'meH nav yIDIj:sen:nolink} or {DI'raq DanarghmoHmeH nav yIDIj:sen:nolink} "Piirrä lammas paperille!"[2]

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: This word is not defined as such in canon, but appears in the example from {TKD p.171:src}. This entry is here for ease of reference only.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is one of three key ingredients neede to make {ngat:n:1}.
Dies ist eine der drei Hauptzutaten für {ngat:n:1}.
In "Travels Through Spain" by Sir John Talbot Dillon, he describes various methods of making saltpeter.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a traded commodity, like {qevaS:n}.
Это товар, которым можно торговать, подобно {qevaS:n}.
There is a genus of Terran flowering plants called the trillium. However, it seems that this word may actually refer to a mineral or perhaps a type of gemstone, although this is unclear.

offener Durchgang (zu Korridor, Tunnel, Rohrleitung, Jeffriesröhre, Kanalisation usw.)
ورودی باز (به راهرو، تونل، کانال، لوله جفری، شاخه‌ای از فاضلاب)

открытый проход (в коридор, тунель, трубопровод, Трубу Джеффри, ветвь коллектора)
開放式入口通道（走廊、隧道、管道、杰弗里斯管、下水道分支）
entrada aberta (para corredor, túnel, conduto, tubo Jeffries, filial do esgoto)
oveton sisäänkäynti, aukko (tunneliin, putkeen, viemäriin tms.)
entrée ouverte (vers couloir, tunnel, conduit, tube Jeffries, branchement d'égout)

This refers to the open entryway leading into a longish enclosed space, or in other words a {qa'rI':n} at or from which one can enter or exit. If there's a door there, the door is referred to by the usual word, {lojmIt:n}.[2; 3]

This is a private joke referring to a specific person.
The description originally given in the {KLI:src} New Klingon Words list says that if there is "a door that closes", then the entryway is "not a {DIn:n:nolink}" but "merely a {lojmIt:n:nolink}". However, this is an incorrect interpretation of the definition, as clarified subsequently.[2; 3]
{janSIy:n:name,nolink} relayed a message to the {KLI Discord:src} from Dr. Okrand that the "enclosed space" in the description is important, and that a {qa'rI':n:nolink} must be enclosed to be a {DIn:n:nolink}. Thus, {DIn:n:nolink} can be used for hallways and sewers, but not for rivers and fields.[4]
[1] {HQ 12.2, Jun. 2003:src}, [2] {KLI mailing list 2019.04.11:src}, [3] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2019:src}, [4] {message to KLI Discord 2024.11.27:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: This is generally used for things spinning or rotating continuously or for a long time, while {jIr:v} is used when the thing rotates partially or once or for a few times. For example, one would {jIrmoH:v:2} the steering wheel of a car, while the tires {DIng:v:nolink}.[2]

MO implied at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2011:src} that {DIng:v:nolink} is intransitive by saying that it works in the same way as {jIr:v:nolink}, but did not elaborate on the exact difference between the two verbs. The clarification was later provided in a message to the mailing list in 2021, which also confirmed that it is intransitive.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a slang term for the device and the most common way to refer to it.[1]
Dies ist ein umgangssprachlicher Ausdruck für das Gerät und die häufigste Art es zu benennen.[1]
A non-slang term is unknown at the moment.

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: This word takes the suffix {-Du':n:suff} when it refers to skin still on the body, and {-mey:n:suff} otherwise.[2] (But see {nagh DIr:n} for how to form the plural when it is used to refer to an animal shell.)

Dieses Wort wird mit dem Suffix {-Du':n:suff} pluralisiert, wenn es sich auf Haut bezieht, die noch am Körper ist, sonst mit {-mey:n:suff}.[2] (Aber siehe {nagh DIr:n} für den Plural der Schale eines Tiers.)

Wenn der Kontext klar ist, wird dies manchmal zu {DIr bID:n} verkürzt.

Это название специфичного кожного заболевания со времен Кейлеса

Dies kann sich sowohl auf eine Zeichnung beziehen als auch auf mehrere zusammengenommen.

table.name: mem
table.column: tambor de pele, instrumento de percussão
This is a drum made with animal skin stretched over a cylinder, usually over only one end. If skin is stretched over both ends of a drum, it is an {'o'lav:n}.[1]

Dies ist eine Trommel, die aus Tierhaut besteht, die über einen Zylinder gespannt wurde, normalerweise über eines der Enden. Wenn Haut über beide Ende der Trommel gespannt ist, ist es eine {'o'lav:n}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: To "cave" (see {DIS:n:1}) is to give in to something under pressure. To "dish (out)" is slang for giving away information.

table.name: mem
table.column: For "years ago" and "years from now", see {ben:n:1} and {nem:n}, respectively. For "years old", see {ben:n:2}.
Für "vor x Jahren" und "in x Jahren", siehe jeweils {ben:n:1} und {nem:n}. Für "x Jahre alt", siehe {ben:n:2}.
Для "X лет назаж" и "Х лет от текущего момента", см {ben:n:1} и {nem:n}, соответственно.
▶ {tera' poH jaj wa', jar wa', jaj loSDIch, DIS wa'-Hut-Hut-chorgh. HovpoHvetlh latlh nab yIHutlh.:sen:nolink} "Save this Stardate: Sunday, January 4, 1998"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: There is no traditional Klingon way to say "Happy New Year", though a Klingon might understand {DIS chu' yItIv@@DIS:n:2, chu':v:1, yI-:v, tIv:v} or {DIS chu' DatIvjaj@@DIS:n:2, chu':v:1, Da-:v, tIv:v, -jaj:v} or {DIS chu' botIvjaj@@DIS:n:2, chu':v:1, bo-:v, tIv:v, -jaj:v}.[1]

Не существует традиционного клингонского способа сказать "Счастливого нового года", хотя Клингон может понимать следующие выражения- {DIS chu' yItIv@@DIS:n:2, chu':v:1, yI-:v, tIv:v} или {DIS chu' DatIvjaj@@DIS:n:2, chu':v:1, Da-:v, tIv:v, -jaj:v} или {DIS chu' botIvjaj@@DIS:n:2, chu':v:1, bo-:v, tIv:v, -jaj:v}.[1]
Maltz thought "Merry Christmas" and "Happy New Year" were silly things to say.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is a day on which one recognizes or remembers an event which occurred a number of years ago. Other units of time are possible, such as {jarjaj:n} and {Hoghjaj:n}.
It's also possible to use other units of time such as {tupjaj:n@@tup:n, jaj:n} as a form of word play.
Both cardinal numbers ({DISjaj wa':n@@DISjaj:n, wa':n:num}) and ordinal numbers ({DISjaj wa'DIch:n@@DISjaj:n, wa'DIch:n}) are acceptable for referring to anniversaries.

table.name: mem
table.column: This can refer to any path or route with the same starting and ending point. The path doesn't have to be circular, though it often is. Thus it can be used for "orbit" or "lap (around a track)", for example.[1]

Kann sich auf einen Pfad oder eine Route beziehen, die den selben Anfangs- und Enpunkt hat. Der Pfad muss nicht kreisrund sein, ist es aber oft. Es kann daher für z.B. "Umlaufbahn" oder "Runde (auf einer Bahn)" benutzt werden.[1]

Peut se référer à un chemin ou une route avec le même point de départ et bout. La route n'est pas nécessairement circulaire, mais l'est souvent. Il peut donc s'utiliser pour p.ex. "orbite" ou "tour (d'un circuit)".[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of a Federation starship.
Det här är namnet på ett Federationsskepp.
Tämä on erään Liiton tähtialuksen nimi.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the Klingon plant most like a fern. For the Earth plant, precede with {tera':n}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: In {Star Trek First Contact:src}, Ruby was the name of a character in a Dixon Hill holonovel.

table.name: mem
table.column: federation, organisation, förening, sammanslutning, förbund, union

This word is used to refer to "the Federation", a shortened form of "the United Federation of Planets" ({yuQjIjDIvI':n}).
Coincidentally or not, this words sounds similar to {DI vI':n:nolink} "it accumulates debris".

Это слово использовано, чтобы сказать о "Федерации", т.е о сокращенной форме "Объединенной федерации планет" ({yuQjIjDIvI':n}).
Случайно или нет, это слово звучит похоже на {DI vI':n:nolink} "Оно заряжает обломки".
The real reason {DIvI':n:nolink} and {DI vI':n:nolink} sound alike is because of the backfitting of {vaj toDuj Daj ngeHbej DI vI'.:sen}

"Do It Yourself" is a term used to describe home improvement without the assistance of professionals.

This is a fluffy, woolly, shaggy Klingon animal. A ram would be a {DI'raq loD:n@@DI'raq:n, loD:n}, and an ewe would be a {DI'raq be':n@@DI'raq:n, be':n}.
Tämä on pörröinen ja villavainen klingoneläin. Uros eli pässi on {DI'raq loD:n@@DI'raq:n, loD:n} ja naaras eli uuhi on {DI'raq be':n@@DI'raq:n, be':n}.
The Dirac equation failed to predict the Lamb shift.

Смотрите {qawmoH:v} для примера того, как использовать глагол, как этот.

This word is listed among other militaristic terminology in the body of {KGT:src} on p.48.
If this verb follows the example of {qawmoH:v}, then the subject of {DoHmoH:v:nolink} does the driving back, {-vaD:n} marks that which is driven back, and the object is the thing or location it is driven back from.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word can refer to people or otherwise. Even if referring only to beings capable of using language, one would normally say {Dojmey:n} rather than {Dojpu':n:nolink}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: mass, masses, multitude, a very large but indeterminate group of something
Massen, Mengen, eine große aber unbekannte Anzahl von Gegenständen oder Personen
توده، توده ها، جمعیت، یک گروه بسیار بزرگ اما نامعلوم چیزی است
massa, massor, mångfald, en mycket stor men obestämd grupp av något
масса, массы, множество, очень большая, но неопределенная группа чего-то
群眾、眾多、一個非常大但不確定的群體
massa, massas, multidão, um grupo muito grande mas indeterminado de algo

masse, masses, multitude, un groupe très vaste mais indéterminé de quelque chose
This word can refer to people or otherwise. Even if referring only to beings capable of using language, one would normally say {Dojmey:n:nolink} rather than {Dojpu':n:nolink}.[1]
The example sentence is a lip-match for {'ej DochmeywIj vItlhapqa'meH}.
▶ {'ej Dojmey wID, vInDa'ma' peq.:sen@@'ej:conj, Dojmey:n, wID:v, vInDa':n, -ma':n, peq:v} "He has killed many of our people."[2] ▶ {qoq De'wI' Dojmey:n}

table.column: ▶ {DojneS mIplIj.:sen@@Doj:v, -neS:v, mIp:n, -lIj:n} "Your wealth is impressive, your honor."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is defined as "entity" in {TKD:src} and as "whole" in {TKW:src}.
The line from the {paq'batlh:src} was revised in the 2ed, and the word {Dol:n:nolink} no longer appears in it.
▶ {wa' Dol nIvDaq matay'DI' maQap.:sen} ▶ {wa' Dol bIH qa''e' porgh'e' je.:sen@@wa':n:num, Dol:n, bIH:n:pro, qa':n, -'e':n, porgh:n, -'e':n, je:conj} "Spirit and body are one."[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: parallel sein, zu etwas parallel verlaufen
vara parallell, röra sig parallellt med
быть параллельным, идти параллельно чему-то, идти параллельно кому-то
To say that two or more things are parallel, this verb is used with a plural subject.[2]
Чтобы сказать, что две или более вещи являются параллельными, глагол используется с подлежащим во множественном числе.[2]
The "go parallel to" definition suggests that this verb can be used transitively. However, the noun {HeDon} also suggests that {Don} acts like a verb of quality.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This refers to a direction like "left" and "right", and not to the side surface of an object which also has a front and a back, for which see {reD:n:3}.[4]
In {Klingon Monopoly:src}, {Dop:n:nolink} is used to indicate one face of a playing card.[3]

Based on usage, its homophony with {Dop:v:1}, and information revealed at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2021:src}, this word refers to something which has a definite opposite side, like the "face" of a playing card or a polygon, as opposed to {reD:n:3,nolink}, which refers to the "side" of something which is more 3-dimensional.
This was defined as "side". The clarification "direction, face" was added to differentiate it from {reD:n:3,nolink}.
▶ {DopDaq qul yIchenmoH QobDI' ghu'.:sen}[2] ▶ {'echletHom Dopvam yIcha':sen:nolink} "card must be turned this side up"[3]
▶ {DopDaq qul yIchenmoH QobDI' ghu'.:sen}[2] ▶ {'echletHom Dopvam yIcha':sen:nolink} "Die Karte muss mit dieser Seite oben liegen"[3]
▶ {DopDaq qul yIchenmoH QobDI' ghu'.:sen}[2] ▶ {'echletHom Dopvam yIcha':sen:nolink} "карта должна быть развернута этой стороной наверх"[3]
▶ {DopDaq qul yIchenmoH QobDI' ghu'.:sen}[2] ▶ {'echletHom Dopvam yIcha':sen:nolink} "Carte doit avoir cette face tournée vers le haut"[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: be opposite, be antithetical, be contradictory
gegenteilig sein, entgegengesetzt sein, umgekehrt sein
être opposé, être antithétique, être contradictoire

The construction {DopmoH:v} is used for reversing a list.[1]
This is also used as a single-word sentence (without affixes) meaning something like "on the contrary" or "au contraire". A stronger version is the idiomatic {bIQ ngaS HIvje'lIj.:sen@@bIQ ngaS HIvje'.:sen}[2]

Die Konstruktion {DopmoH:v} wird für das Umdrehen einer Liste benutzt.[1]
Dies wird auch als "Doch!" benutzt (ohne Affixe). Eine stärkere Version ist das idiomatische {bIQ ngaS HIvje'lIj.:sen@@bIQ ngaS HIvje'.:sen}[2]

La construction {DopmoH:v} s'utilise pour renverser une liste.[1]
Ceci peut aussi s'utiliser pour dire "Si!" (sans affixes). Une version plus forte est l'expression idiomatique {bIQ ngaS HIvje'lIj.:sen@@bIQ ngaS HIvje'.:sen}[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: منفی بودن (در ریاضی استفاده می شود)
This is just the verb {Dop:v:1} applied to numbers in mathematics.

table.name: mem
table.column: Set fire on the side when there is danger.
Stell das Feuer beiseite wenn Gefahr droht.
هنگامی که خطر وجود دارد، آتش را در کنار آن قرار دهید.
Sätt eld på sidan när det finns fara.
Разведи огонь сбоку, когда грозит опасность.
Atear fogo ao lado quando houver perigo.
Kun tilanne on vaarallinen, sytytä sivulle tuli.
Allumez le feu sur le côté en cas de danger.

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb also covers colors which would be called "brown". To differentiate a brown object from another object which could also be described using {Doq:v:nolink}, a phrase such as {Doq 'ej wovbe':sen@@Doq:v, 'ej:conj, wov:v, -be':v} is used.[2] The word {Doqqu':v@@Doq:v, -qu':v} refers to a color more red than orange.[3]

All natural languages found on Earth divide colours into "warm" and "cool" in the same way. Klingon distinguishes between {Doq:v:nolink} and {SuD:v:1}, but it groups "yellow" with the "cool" colours rather than with the "warm" colours.

▶ {HIq Doqqu':n@@HIq:n, Doq:v, -qu':v} "red liquor"[3] ▶ {Doq 'ej beqpuj rur:sen@@Doq:v, 'ej:conj, beqpuj:n, rur:v} (bright orange)[3] ▶ {Doq 'ej wovbe':sen@@Doq:v, 'ej:conj, wov:v, -be':v} "brown"[2; 4] ▶ {Doqqu' 'ej wov:sen@@Doq:v, -qu':v, 'ej:conj, wov:v} or {Doqqu' 'ach wov:sen@@Doq:v, -qu':v, 'ach:conj, wov:v} "pink"[4]

table.name: mem
table.column: چیزی مهم است اتفاق افتاده است

The expressions {Doq bIQtIq:sen:nolink} ("the river is red") and {Doq bIQtIq bIQ:sen:nolink} ("the river water is red") can be traced back to an old drinking song commemorating the slaying of {molor:n:name} by {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name}.

Выражения {Doq bIQtIq:sen:nolink} ("река красная") и {Doq bIQtIq bIQ:sen:nolink} ("вода реки красная") могут быть прослежены от старой застольной песни, напоминающей, как {qeylIS'e' lIjlaHbe'bogh vay':n:name} убил {molor:n:name}.

table.name: mem
table.column: to be a particular shade of brown
Doq und wie Kradsch-Lippen (ein bräunlicher Ton)
att vara en viss skugga av brunt
ser um tom particular de marrom
être d'une nuance particulière de brun
A kradge has brown lips. This expression is used to describe an object which is a particular shade of brown (see {Doq 'ej wovbe':sen}).

table.name: mem
table.column: To be more specific about the shade of brown, a comparison is used. For example, one might say {Doq 'ej Qaj wuS rur:sen} (kradge lips are a particular shade of brown).[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: The object of this verb can be physical things such as a territory or a sword, or more abstract concepts such as authority.
Even though the definition says "territory", the canon usages show that this is just an example, and {DoQ:v:nolink} can be used to claim other things.

table.name: mem
table.column: sink for cleaning hands, face, food, etc.
Becken, Wanne, Spüle, z.B. in Küche oder Bad
سینک برای شستن دست، صورت، غذا و غیره
handfat för rengöring av händer, ansikte, mat, etc.
раковина для мытья рук, лица, еды и т. д.
用於清潔手、臉、食物等的水槽
pia para limpeza de mãos, rosto, comida, etc.
évier pour nettoyer les mains, le visage, la nourriture, etc.
A bathtub or swimming pool would be a {DoQmIv'a':n}. A {DoQmIvHom:n@@DoQmIv:n, -Hom:n} would be a bucket or anything similar.

table.name: mem
table.column: If necessary, "bathtub" and "swimming pool" can be distinguished using qualifiers: {Say'moHmeH DoQmIv'a':n}, {QalmeH DoQmIv'a':n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: ta slut (om tidsperiod, t.ex. månad, år)
terminar, ir para o fim (de um período de tempo)
finir, se terminer (une période de temps)
The subject of this verb is a period or unit of time, such as a month. It should not be an event the ending of which one has some control over (for which see {van:v:2}, {ghang:v}).
Tämän verbin subjekti on ajanjakso (esim. kuukausi), joka loppuu itsestään. Jos joku lopettaa ajanjakson tai tapahtuman, tämän verbin sijasta sanotaan {van:v:2} tai {ghang:v}.
▶ {tugh Dor qoSlIj. nom yIlop!@@tugh:adv, Dor:v:2, qoS:n, -lIj:n, nom:adv, yI-:v, lop:v}[2]

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: This idiomatic expression, which literally means to lose or misplace a target, means "to digress". {DoS vIchIl:sen:nolink} means "I digress", and so on.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is generally crafted from bone.

table.name: mem
table.column: This can be used with people, but has a disparaging connotation, unlike {choy:v} which is used only with people.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: Wagen, Karren (einachsiges Fahrzeug, gezogen oder geschoben)
سبد خرید (وسیله نقلیه چرخ دار ، کشیده شده یا تحت فشار)
тележка (транспортное средство на колесах, которое тянут или толкают)
推車（輪式車輛，拉動或推入）
carrinho (veículo com rodas, puxado ou empurrado)
kärry (vedetty tai työnnetty pyörillä kulkeva ajoneuvo)
chariot (véhicule à roues, tiré ou poussé)
This can have any number of wheels (typically two).
This is a reference to the D'Oyly Carte Opera Company.

table.name: mem
table.column: It is unclear if {tlhuch:v} "exhaust" means to "tire someone out".

table.name: mem
table.column: vara tursam, vara lyckosam, ha tur, ha lycka
быть благоприятным, быть счастливым, быть удачливым
avoir de la chance, être chanceux

table.name: mem
table.column: vara otursam, vara olycksdrabbad, ha otur

table.name: mem
table.column: This is essentially the verb {Do'Ha':v} as a standalone sentence.

table.name: mem
table.column: Though originally referring to a mass of creatures of some sort (such as {maqSung Do':n@@maqSung:n, Do':n:1} "swarm of bees"), the word's meaning is sometimes broadened and used for masses of inanimate objects (such as {wolmeye' Do':n@@wolmeye':n, Do':n:1} "swarm of drones"). {HoSDo':n:nolink} may have formerly been {HoS Do':n@@HoS:n:1, Do':n:1}.[1]

Zwar bezieht es sich ursprünglich auf eine Menge von Kreaturen irgendeiner Art (wie {maqSung Do':n@@maqSung:n, Do':n:1} "Bienenschwarm"), aber die Bedeutung dieses Worts wird manchmal auf Mengen unbelebter Dinge erweitert (wie {wolmeye' Do':n@@wolmeye':n, Do':n:1} "Dronenschwarm"). {HoSDo':n:nolink} könnte ursprünglich {HoS Do':n@@HoS:n:1, Do':n:1} gewesen sein.[1]

Bien qu'il se référait originairement à une masse de créatures de quelque sorte (comme {maqSung Do':n@@maqSung:n, Do':n:1} "essaim d'abeilles"), la signification de ce mot est parfois élargi pour parler de masses d'objets inanimés (comme {wolmeye' Do':n@@wolmeye':n, Do':n:1} "essaim de drones"). {HoSDo':n:nolink} peut avoir auparavent été {HoS Do':n@@HoS:n:1, Do':n:1}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: mollet (arrière du bas de la jambe)
This means the back of the lower leg. It's possible to say {'uS Do'ghI':n:nolink}, but {'uS:n:nolink} tends to be used only if a distinction or comparison is being made with {DeS Do'ghI':n}.[2]
"Git Along, Little Dogies" is a traditional cowboy ballad. "Dogie" is a regional US word used to refer to a calf (bovine animal) separated from its mother.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of a planet which was disputed between the United Federation of Planets ({yuQjIjDIvI':n}) and the Klingon Empire ({tlhIngan wo':n}).
Это название планеты, что является предметом спора между Объединенной Федерацией Планет ({yuQjIjDIvI':n}) и Клингонской Империей ({tlhIngan wo':n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a reference to the soap opera "Days Of Our Lives". The opening voiceover begins, "Like sands through the hourglass...".

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the kind of stone Klingons use to sharpen their knives, bat'leths, and so on.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column:
The object is the thing which is improved.
This verb is used for improvement of a more abstract nature, such as in status, skill, understanding, etc. For improvement in a more concrete sense, see {rach:v}.[2]

Объектом является вещь, которую улучшили.
Этот глагол использован для описания улучшений более абстрактных вещей, таких как статус, опыт, понимание и т.д.. Для описания улучшений в более конкретном смысле, смотрите {rach:v}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: If it's in your way, knock it down.
Wenn dir etwas im Wege steht, schlag es nieder.
اگر آن را در راه خود، دست کشیدن آن را.
Om det är på din väg, slå ner det.
Если он на твоем пути, сбей его.
如果它阻擋了你，擊倒它。
Se estiver no seu caminho, derrube-o.
Jos se on tielläsi, kaada se.
Si cela vous gêne, faites-le tomber.

table.name: mem
table.column: мешать(компоненты друг с другом), перемешивать, смешивать

table.name: mem
table.column: As a joke, this is missing from the E-K side of {TKD:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: {nach Hom:n@@nach:n, Hom:n:1} is also fine, but {DughrI':n:nolink} is a more technical term.

table.name: mem
table.column: This can be used for a "setting" in a {SeHlaw:n}.[2]
Это может быть использовано в качестве "настройки" в {SeHlaw:n}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a type of {jem'IH:n}. This word can be used if the emphasis is to be on the elegance or grandeur of the building.
The Palatine Hill is one of the hills of Rome ({rom HuD:sen:nolink}).

table.name: mem
table.column: type of animal, lobster (Klingon animal found in water with a huge claw)
type d'animal, homard (animal Klingon trouvé dans l'eau avec une énorme griffe)
This is a Klingon animal found in the water which has a huge claw.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word can refer to any vehicle, not just spaceships, by specifying the environment in which the vehicle travels. See {puH Duj:n}, {muD Duj:n}, {bIQ Duj:n}.
Some special terminology is used for the parts of a {Duj:n:1h,nolink}. The section towards its {tlhop:n:1h} is called its {'et:n:2h}, while the section towards its {'em:n} is called its {'o':n}. To refer to a ship's dorsal, ventral, port, and starboard areas, see {Dung:n}, {bIng:n}, {poS:n}, and {nIH:n}, respectively.
For verbs related to ship movement, see under {'or:v}.
Known classes of Klingon ships include {neghvar:n}, {vorcha':n}, {qItI'nga':n}, {qISa'ruj:n}, and {toQDuj:n}.

Слово может относиться к любому транспортному средству, необязательно к космическим кораблям, определением среды, в котором судно будет перемещаться. Смотрите {puH Duj:n}, {muD Duj:n}, {bIQ Duj:n}.
Для глаголов, относящихся к движению корабля, смотрите {'or:v}.
Известные классы Клингонских кораблей включают {neghvar:n}, {vorcha':n}, {qItI'nga':n}, {qISa'ruj:n}, и {toQDuj:n}.
vehicle, craft, boat, barge, spaceship, starship

table.name: mem
table.column: It is grammatically correct to treat this word as singular (a bundle of instincts) or plural (individual instincts).[2, p.27]
Грамматически корректно рассматривать это слово в единственном числе(набор инстинктов) или во множественном (индивидуальные инстинкты)

table.name: mem
table.column: 不負責任的人、沒有紀律的人
A standard verb which is close in meaning to this is {ngIj:v}.[1, p.150]

table.name: mem
table.column: همیشه اعتماد به غرایز خود را
Faites toujours confiance à votre instinct.

table.name: mem
table.column: DujDaj HubtaHvIS Hegh 'e' tul Hoch tlhIngan.
To die defending his ship is the hope of every Klingon.
Es ist die Hoffnung jedes Klingonen zu sterben während er sein Schiff verteidigt.
به خاطر دفاع از کشتی خود، امید هر کلینگان است.
Att dö försvara sitt skepp är hoppet på varje Klingon.
Умереть, защищая его корабль, надежда каждого Клингона.
為了保衛他的艦而死是每個克林崗人的希望。
Morrer defendendo sua embarcação é a esperança de todo klingon.
Jokainen klingoni toivoo kuolevansa puolustaessaan alustaan.
Mourir en défendant son vaisseau est l'espoir de chaque Klingon.

table.name: mem
table.column: There is nothing shameful in falling before a superior enemy.
Es ist nicht schmachvoll vor einem überlegenen Feind zu verlieren.
هیچ چیز شرم آور در سقوط قبل از یک دشمن برتر وجود ندارد.
Det finns inget skamligt att falla för en överlägsen fiende.
Нет ничего постыдного, чтобы пасть перед превосходящим врагом.
在一個優勢敵人面前墜落並沒有什麼可恥的。
Não há nada de vergonhoso em cair diante de um inimigo superior.
Ei ole häpeällistä hävitä ylivoimaiselle viholliselle.
Il n'y a rien de honteux à tomber devant un ennemi supérieur.

table.name: mem
table.column: بسیاری از کشتی ها را هدایت کرده است
a navigué sur de nombreux navires
▶ {Dujmey law' DachIjpu':sen:nolink} "You have navigated many ships", i.e., "You are experienced".

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the geometric figure, and not to an astronomical body, for which see {Hov:n}.
Это относится к геометрической фигуре, а не к астрономическому телу, для которого смотрите {Hov:n}.

This seems to be made up of the words {Duj:n:1} and {tlhuQ:n}.
The logo of Star Alliance, the largest airline alliance on Earth, is often painted on the tailfins of its members' airplanes.

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {ta'mey Dun, bommey Dun.:sen} ▶ {qIbDaq SuvwI''e' SoH Dun law' Hoch Dun puS.:sen}

table.name: mem
table.column: See {'aqroS:n:1} and {yor:n} for the top parts of an object. See also {lurgh:n} for other words related to spatial directions.
Смотрите {'aqroS:n:1} и {yor:n} для верхних частей объекта. Смотрите также {lurgh:n} для других слов, имеющих отношение к направлениям в пространстве.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a way to "dupe" your enemies.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a bowl used for eating {chatlh:n:1}, which a diner pours into the {Duq:n:nolink} from a {maHpIn:n}.[1, p.99]
Norm Duke is the name of a successful American professional bowler. Also, "duckpin bowling" is a variation of "ten-pin bowling" using a smaller ball.

table.name: mem
table.column: This means in the sense of astonished, astounded, dumbfounded, shocked. It is stronger than {yay':v}.
Dies ist im Sinne von erstaunt, umgeworfen, schockiert. Es ist stärker als {yay':v}.
Это употребляется в смысле изумленный, ошеломленный, шокированый. Это сильнее, чем {yay':v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is said of good music or food.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is used to refer to the spikes attached to {pogh:n}, {ghanjaq:n}, {'alngegh:n}, and so on.
For a stand-alone spike such as a stake, see {wIl:n}.
This was defined as just "spike" in {KGT:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is used to refer to the little spikes found on the {Daqtagh:n}.[1, p.61]

table.name: mem
table.column: This term was not defined independently, but is inferred from {Duran lung DIr:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Duraniska ödleskinn (en slags mat, tar aldrig pluralsuffix)
This is a food item. It never uses any plural suffix.
Этот предмет употребляется в пищу. Он никогда не используется ни с какими суффиксами множественного числа

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a device which requires another device, like a key, or a code to open.
In Germany, locked doors found in public often have a sign saying "kein Durchgang" (no passage). Marc Okrand has said that this was not intentional.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a type of quartz that has a waxy luster and varies from transparent to translucent.[1]
Eine Quarzart mit wachsartigem Glanz, deren Transparenz von transparent bis durchscheinend variiert.[1]
Ceci est un type de quartz avec un lustre cireux et qui varie de transparent à translucide.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is used for launching a {peng:n}.
The distinction between a {DuS:n:nolink} and a {chetvI':n:1} has to do with how the projectile is loaded.[2]

Используется для запуска торпеды {peng:n}.
Различие между {DuS:n:nolink} и {chetvI':n:1} прийдется сделать по мере загруженности проэкта.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the most general word for a place of learning.[2]
Это наиболее общее слово для места обучения.[2]
It's probably just a coincidence that this word looks like it's formed from {Du-:v} and {SaQ:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: painaa (leimasin) alas, lyödä esine voimallisesti alas
There is a Seinfeld skit about how one can't slam down a mobile phone, but must swipe or press a button ("doot").
▶ {toqwIn vIDut@@toqwIn:n, vI-:v, Dut:v:1} "I slam down the stamp."

table.name: mem
table.column: olla viallinen, olla puutteellinen, olla rikki

table.name: mem
table.column: The earliest dice were made from bones ({HomDu':n@@Hom:n:1, -Du':n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to fruits or vegetables that come from a farm, as opposed to {naH tlhab:n}.[1, p.89]
Это относится к фруктам или овощам, что приходят с фермы, как противоположность к {naH tlhab:n}.[1, стр.89]

table.name: mem
table.column: این کلاه‌خود برای تو مناسب است
There is a typo in this sentence in {TKD:src}, an extra space right after {mIv:n:1}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is bigger than your everday {Du'QamHom:n}.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the closest Klingon equivalent to a sunflower.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the indentation just above the middle of the upper lip.
The cover of the Duran Duran album Rio features an iconic pair of lips.
